global.token: Discord token for your bot that you can find at https://discordapp.com/developers/applications
global.presence: Discord presence message for the bot to display
global.presence_type: Discord presence type from (playing, listening, watching) default: playing
global.discord_member_count_channel_id: Discord Channel ID to display a count of members in the discord
global.discord_member_count_format: Format for the discord member count, using {count} as a placeholder
global.log_player_count_updates: Send player count update notices to admin log channel
global.debug: Set the logging level to DEBUG for the locally running app. Equivalent to running with -v

servers.ip: IP address of your DayZ server
servers.rcon_port: RCon port for your DayZ server (may be different from the game port)
servers.rcon_password: RCon password, found in the BattlEye profile directory in your server files
servers.admin_channel_id: Discord Channel ID that can send admin RCon commands and where logs are sent
servers.chat_channel_id: Discord Channel ID where the linked DayZ to Discord chat will take place
servers.chat_ignore_regex: Pattern that, if matched, will not publish the message to the chat channel
servers.chat_show_connect_disconnect_notices: Send connect and disconnect notices to chat channel
servers.player_count_channel_id: Discord Channel ID that will have its name updated to the current player count
servers.player_count_format: Format for setting the channel name using {players}, {slots}, {queue}, and {time} as placeholders for the values
servers.player_count_update_interval: Time, in seconds, between player count update queries
servers.log_rcon_messages: Send all RCon messages to admin log channel
servers.log_rcon_keep_alive: Send RCon keep alive status messages to admin log channel

scheduled_commands.command: RCon command to run with parameters. Also accepts 'safe_shutdown'. See the template for examples
scheduled_commands.delay: Only used for 'safe_shutdown'. Specifies the delay in seconds before the shutdown
scheduled_commands.interval: Interval in seconds between runs of the command
scheduled_commands.with_clock: Whether the interval should be aligned with the clock instead of relative
scheduled_commands.offset: Delay in seconds from bot startup to running the command, or offset from midnight if with_clock is true

custom_commands.channels: List of channel ids to enable the command for. If not present or empty, command will work in every channel
custom_commands.command: Regex pattern that, if matched, will trigger the command
custom_commands.response: Discord embed object as described by https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/channel#embed-object
